title: Brother or close relative for levirate
vignette: Ronan dies childless leaving a widow. His surviving brother lives abroad but a close cousin is available locally.

options.text: Wait for the brother to perform levirate union or release ceremony.
Let the cousin marry her to keep property in the family.

title: Declining levirate union for personal reasons
vignette: The brother-in-law finds the widow unattractive and prefers not to marry her, though she wants the union.

options.text: Perform release ceremony and let her marry elsewhere.
Proceed with levirate union despite discomfort to uphold tradition.

title: levirate union vs. existing engagement
vignette: A man engaged to another woman becomes obligated in levirate marriage when his brother dies.

options.text: Break his engagement and fulfill levirate union first.
Proceed with his engagement and perform release ceremony instead.

title: Pregnant widow and uncertain paternity
vignette: A widow is pregnant when her husband dies. It's unclear whether the child will be viable.

options.text: Delay levirate union until after birth to see if a son survives.
Perform release ceremony immediately so she can remarry.

title: levirate union with partial conversion
vignette: The surviving brother is mid-conversion process and not fully observant yet.

options.text: Wait until conversion is complete before deciding.
Let him perform release ceremony now to release the widow.

title: Minor brother's obligation
vignette: The only surviving brother is twelve years old.

options.text: Postpone until he matures even if the widow must wait years.
Allow release ceremony from an adult relative instead.

title: Refusing levirate union to protect inheritance
vignette: The brother fears marrying the widow will split his own estate among her future sons.

options.text: Perform release ceremony to preserve his property.
Proceed with levirate union despite financial loss.

title: Widow engaged to a senior professional
vignette: After her husband dies, the widow receives a proposal from a senior professional before levirate union occurs.

options.text: Insist on levirate union or release ceremony first.
Permit immediate marriage to the senior professional and ignore levirate union.

title: release ceremony in public vs. private
vignette: The parties prefer to perform release ceremony quietly to avoid embarrassment.

options.text: Allow a private ceremony with minimal witnesses.
Insist on the standard public ritual.

title: Widow refuses both options
vignette: The widow neither wants to marry the brother nor participate in release ceremony.

options.text: Compel her to undergo release ceremony to free her.
Leave her unmarried until she consents.

title: Suspected adulterous widow
vignette: Rumors circulate that the widow had an affair before her husband died.

options.text: Investigate thoroughly and withhold levirate union until cleared.
Ignore unproven gossip and proceed with levirate union.

title: Halitzah shoes unavailable
vignette: The ritual requires a specific leather shoe but none are accessible.

options.text: Delay until a proper shoe is found.
Use a makeshift shoe to avoid prolonging her limbo.

title: Travel costs for levirate union ceremony
vignette: The brother lives overseas and the widow cannot afford the trip for release ceremony.

options.text: Community should fund her travel to fulfill the duty.
Allow proxy release ceremony performed locally.

title: Widow pregnant from another man
vignette: Before levirate union, the widow becomes pregnant through a consensual relationship.

options.text: Require release ceremony only; levirate union is now forbidden.
Permit levirate union anyway to legitimize the child.

title: Multiple brothers â€“ who chooses?
vignette: Three brothers survive; each is eligible for levirate union.

options.text: Let the widow choose which brother performs the rite.
Oldest brother has precedence regardless of her wish.
